meanings.definition: Ruling or dominant in a political or social context.
meanings.sent1: The hegemonic power in the region dictated the laws and policies.
meanings.sent2: The company's hegemonic position in the market allowed it to set prices.
meanings.sent3: The hegemonic squirrel in the park always got the biggest acorns.
meanings.sent4: Her hegemonic presence in the debate made it clear who was in charge.
meanings.sent5: The hegemonic mountain stood tall, casting a shadow over the entire valley.

meanings.definition: Exercising control or influence over others.
meanings.sent1: The hegemonic boss made all the decisions without consulting the team.
meanings.sent2: The hegemonic leader's charisma captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The hegemonic cat ruled the neighborhood, demanding treats from everyone.
meanings.sent4: His hegemonic grip on the situation ensured everything went according to plan.
meanings.sent5: The hegemonic sun shone brightly, warming everything in its path.

meanings.definition: Reflecting or embodying the cultural, social, or political beliefs of a dominant group.
meanings.sent1: The hegemonic art style of the era influenced all other forms of expression.
meanings.sent2: Her fashion choices were hegemonic, setting trends for the entire school.
meanings.sent3: The hegemonic cake at the party disappeared within minutes, showing its popularity.
meanings.sent4: The hegemonic language of the ruling class shaped communication across the nation.
meanings.sent5: The hegemonic tree in the forest towered above the rest, symbolizing strength and power.
